Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Arraignment as to Emare Pacheco-Correa (3) Count 1,2 held on 4/25/2007. Bail Hearing as to Emarc Pacheco-Correa held on 4/25/2007. AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and Atty. Johnny Rivera were present. Defendant waived reading of indictment. PONG entered. Defendant remains under custody. Defendant is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel proffered that defendant voluntarily surrender, is not using substances, has strong family ties, his sister and parents are willing to post their homes for bond purpose, have a thir party custodian, defendant to reside at home and wear an electronic monitoring device. The Government proffered that while defendant was on bond in the local court, defendant committed the violation in this case and request detention without bail. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Order will follow. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Hilda Gutierrez, PTSO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br, ) (Entered: 04/25/2007)

ORDER as to Carmen L. Quiles-Melendez. On October 9, 2007, this court ordered, at the joint request of the parties, that defendant be transferred to the Bureau of Prisons ("BOP") facility in Butner, North Carolina, or some other appropriate facility to be designated by the BOP, to receive a mental competency evaluation and treatment. (Docket No. 230). The Clerk notified the BOP and the USMS of this order the following day. The court has been informed that as of today - more than three months after the order was notified - the BOP still has not designated the defendant to an appropriate facility. Given the BOP's failure to cooperate and to comply with the court's order, I see no alternative but to keep the defendant at MDC Guaynabo and to appoint a mental health professional to perform the evaluation. Accordingly, the order to transfer the defendant entered at Docket No. 230 is hereby VACATED, and the USMS and BOP are hereby ORDERED to keep the defendant at MDC Guaynabo pending any further order of the court. The Clerk shall notify the USMS and MDC Guaynabo of this order by telephone and fax. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin on January 25, 2008.(McGiverin, Bruce) (Entered: 01/25/2008)

ORDER as to Carmen L. Quiles-Melendez. A status conference was held in chambers before the undersigned. Present were AUSA Dina Avila for the government and Jorge Rivera-Ortiz, Esq. for the defendant. Given the failure of the BOP to comply with the order issued at Docket No. 230, and at the request of the parties, the court resolved to vacate that order and appoint a mental health professional to evaluate the defendant at MDC Guaynabo. Accordingly, the court shall issue an order appointing Dr. Cynthia Casanova-Pelosi to evaluate the defenant and render a report as to whether she is competent to stand trial or to enter a plea of guilty. Attorney Rivera-Ortiz shall contact Dr. Casanova to notify her of the appointment order, and by not later than February 5, 2008 shall inform the court (1) whether she accepts the appointment; and (2) her estimated date for completing the report, which shall be filed under seal. Once a report is submitted, the court shall, if necessary, set a date for a mental competency hearing. IT IS SO ORDERED. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Bruce J.
